Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: 1. Onbaording - making a user feel like he's just using an app, rather than going through a tutorial. Modern mobile games have have mastered this principle. 2. Levels - accounts will have levels based on their thrusthworthyness. You will earn those levels by completing (carefully selected) tasks which if properly executed will incentivize the player (user) to return to the app, generate more content and try to become the best contributor. 3. Achievements and Badges - users will earn these by completing fun travel challenges. For example they will recieve a "reviewed a nightclub at 5 a.m." badge or "travelled 5 continents". Another classic gamification element that incentivizes the users to engage the app, maybe spread the awareness and of course contribute more.

Bancor is a decentralized liquidity network based in Zug, Switzerland. Bancor completed a historic Token Generation Event in June 2017. It aims to unlock the long tail of user-generated currencies by solving the liquidity challenge, allowing any token to be convertible to any other at continuously calculated prices, regardless of volume and outside of exchanges.  By integrating the Bancor Protocol, Futourist token holders will gain access to continuous liquidity regardless of trade volume or exchange listings, through the Bancor Networkâ„¢. Bancor will allow for instant conversion of Futourist Tokens (FTR) directly through Bancorâ€™s simple Web App. Conversion is possible between FTR, BNT, ETH and any token in the growing list of tokens integrated in the network.   The Bancor Protocol utilizes a â€œConnectorâ€ token method which networks tokens together through formulaically calculated prices, without needing to match buyers and sellers like in traditional exchanges. Futourist will activate a Token Relayâ„¢ with 1% of its circulating token supply within the first week following the distribution of the FTR tokens after a successful completion of the Futourist Token Sale.  Futourist rewards users for their reviews with the help of blockchain technology. Contests (companies providing contests where users will be rewarded for their content with FTR tokens). Nearby Offers (users will spend their FTR token on offers provided by companies signed up to the platform). Service reward implementation (matching the right services with the right customers using FTR tokens). About Bancor:  Bancor Protocol is a standard for the creation of Smart Tokensâ„¢, cryptocurrencies with built-in convertibility directly through their smart contracts. Bancor utilizes an innovative token â€œConnectorâ€ method to enable formulaic price calculation and continuous liquidity for all compliant tokens, without needing to match two parties in an exchange. Early last year, Oobah Butler, a freelance journalist obsessed with the fake news reality we all seem to inhabit these days, decided to serve absolute crock to the gullible people of Londonâ€Šâ€”â€Ša fake restaurant that no one has ever visitedâ€Šâ€”â€Šand see if they would eat that bullshit up. He had some experience writing fake TripAdvisor reviews before (and watched how those restaurants reaped the benefits), but now he wanted to push the envelope further.    If you want to check out his whole story, I suggest you take 20 minutes to watch his video. Itâ€™s both hilarious and disturbing, and nicely underscores why your reliance on TripAdvisor (and most other review platforms) is completely misguided.  If you donâ€™t have 20 minutes to spare, hereâ€™s the crux of it.  Oobah created a listing on TripAdvisor, calling his backyard shed The Shed At Dulwich. He got a burner phone (for verification) and the listing was approved in May, 2017. He then proceeded to add fake reviews to it by enlisting his friends and family. He knew he was dealing with a fad-oriented crowd, so he wanted to create a buzz by giving emotion-themed names to his meals: love, lust, comfort, you get the drift.  Hereâ€™s one of those famous meals:  In early November, after only five months, The Shed At Dulwich secured the coveted first place on TripAdvisorâ€Šâ€”â€ŠWITHOUT ANYONE EVER SETTING FOOT IN THE PLACE!  I canâ€™t stress this enoughâ€Šâ€”â€ŠOobah never served a single customer in his make-belief restaurant. The description said it was â€˜appointment-onlyâ€™ and he was pretty good at blowing people off when they called to make a reservation, saying that the Shed was booked solidly for months. Oh, and guess what? People called from abroad to make a reservation!  In December of 2017, Oobah decided to cash in on his story (as any good journalist would), and the jig was up. Before that, he hosted an impromptu dinner at the Shed and finally took some real reservations, serving frozen instant dinners to the unsuspecting crowd. At least one customer attempted to make another reservation.  Man, hipsters make it really difficult to like them.  You see now why you need to know about this? If a bogus restaurant can manipulate TripAdvisor into thinking itâ€™s a real place, how easy is it to skew rankings for restaurants that actually do exist?  The answer: very fucking easy.  How Did TripAdvisor Answer To This Colossal Screw Up? If you think that TripAdvisor vowed to change the way it vets the reviews coming in, youâ€™d be sorely mistaken. Their spokesperson said that the listing was already being investigated before the story broke (fat chance, really) and that, in anyway, this wasnâ€™t a real-world case: who manipulates rankings for a non-existent restaurant when thereâ€™s nothing to be gained there?  Thatâ€™s true, Oobah had nothing to gain. However, he did manage to expose the current travel review industry as mostly a sham. While a good number of reviews are real, an astounding number are not. In the world where we trust large information providers with our decisions, this is not acceptable.  Can Online Reviews Earn Our Trust Again?  They can, if we flip the system on its head. Right now, the Futourist team is working on a platform that will incentivize travel-related reviews, as well as people who vet those reviews.  Itâ€™s an ecosystem in which reviewers get paid not under the table, but in plain sight. The community then votes on the reviews of places theyâ€™ve visited, dined at, or shopped in, earning fractions of the FTR coin.  How is this better than the current system?  Itâ€™s not perfect and the Futourist system can still be gamed, but not as much as what we have now. Hereâ€™s why:  Futourists heavily weighs video reviews, which are difficult to fake. Everyone is incentivized for reviews, so the allure of getting paid by a business goes out of the windowâ€Šâ€”â€Šreview what you know and get paid anyway. The community votes on reviewsâ€Šâ€”â€Šobvious fakes will have a hard time standing out.  To learn more about the Futourist check www.futourist.io

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Futourist is about upgrading OpenHours with new features (not just blockchain rewarding protocol). Working with blockchain allows us to implement several steps towards minimising scams that would drain reward for no real value (for example imagine proof of stake implemented the right way). Beside that we are ready to deploy AI and machine learning that would prevent a lot of scammers. When we talk about AI - we are firmly aware of the fact that good AI takes a lot of data, time and testing in order to implement, so this cannot be one of the first rolled out features but once in place it will do the job. And third... building platforms like Futourist means accepting new paradigm where platform gives power back to users - essentially building a self sustaining community that cleans itself, provided developers build features that enable that.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Admins will do most of data scraping and business listing. Businesses will have an option to list themselves (new restaurant opens somewhere) and also users can help us maintain correct information in exchange for rewards. But like said initially, majority of the listings will be done by Futourist team since this is something OpenHours did really well (over 1 mio listed businesses).

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Our plan is to build solid AI that would help us filter out users that write fake reviews. We understand AI implementation can be complex and needs a lot of data in order to build solid AI model, so this functionality will be published when its ready. On existing platforms users that write fake reviews are usually higher level reviewers who have a lot of trust, traction and presence. These same users worked really hard to build their profile to the point where they can monetise their service of fake reviews. For such users implementing some sort of "proof of stake" - staking part of earned tokens or part of earned level before posting can be real turn off to sell fake reviews. On the other hand - we are THE platform that rewards reviews, so users that work hard and build reputation will most likely be able to earn more by staying honest and just keep using the platform as intended.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: I will try to answer this with an example. One of business models we will offer is creating "Discount offers" where businesses who hold FTR tokens create time limited offers that users can buy. Imagine Happy Hour 50% discount on certain drink or food. Obviously all offers have limited target of users interested for that offer - numbers vary from town size, location, period etc. Once we establish and understand each offer audience is limited we know that spending more and more tokens wont increase that audience. So companies that acquire a lot of FTR tokens (in ICO phase or at any later time) are not limited by the platform but by simple supply/demand dynamic on the market. Other business models like creating competitions are again focused around specific location, audience or interest group which is limited by default. So in any scenario a business that acquires large quantities of FTR will have to spend them slowly and controlled and will NOT be able to manipulate platform.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Futourist is built on top of existing platform OpenHours that has over 1mio monthly users. This starting point will enable Futourist to add new features really quickly and start creating review contests funded from Community token pool. Therefore first FTR will go to community relatively shortly after the ICO. In order to calibrate contests to their "final form" we intend to start with few smaller contests - most likely focused on certain Geolocation full of reviewers and early adopters. Once the contests and their final form is finalised we will start with global contests - again funded from Community token pool. At that point businesses will be able to enter platform and start spending tokens - creating demand on exchange, triggering higher token velocity that leads to price growth.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: I'm not quite sure if I understand the question but if the question is about reward distribution I can explain. For reward distribution we are using Pareto distribution. Each contest will have start and end period. On end date of the contest we create a pool of users who entered the contest + their reviews. Users are then ranked by their success and put on the Pareto distribution chart that looks like this:  https://subversion.american.edu/aisaac/notes/images/pareto-smallvals.png  If you look at the curve closely you can see the first few users reward is the highest BUT all users are part of the contest reward pool. Even the last user will receive a portion of tokens. This is called Long Tail rewarding and its intended to motivate and reward all users participating in contests.  Videos will still be handled with Pareto distribution but the time period will be different - most likely on 1 day (24h) period.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Hi!  No one can really prevent such things from happening. On TripAdvisor, we reckon there is a whole lot of reviews being written by people with heavy conflict of interest. But the bare quantity of other reviews each business gets makes that one questionable review get lost in the crowd. We believe that if TripAdvisor can make it work, we can make it work at least as well.  The main feature of Futourist dealing with problems of trust is account Level. Users will gain trust by contributing (reviewing etc) to the platform and this will be reflected in the users account Level. Higher account levels should be trusted more and will have more voting power when calculating the reward for that review. In case of someone making an account to upvote their own business, is kind of similar to a newbie account on BitcoinTalk posting something big things about a very specific ICO - there has got to be something he's not saying out loud.  Another thing to keep in mind here, is that trust is connected to the type of content a reviewer is submitting. It's much easier to make a dishonest text review than it is to make a dishonest video review. And Futourist will prefer video reviews over text reviews.

Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Hi!  That's a good question. The answer is somewhat long. Bot accounts can be identified and limited through things like phone verification and especially AI finding bot behavior patterns in the fake account activity log. In the case of 1000 fake upvotes, our AI mechanism will have an easy task of identifying this pattern. A simple way of the top of my head would be comparing view count and reactions to video. Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Hi there.  Gamification pratices will be used across the app.  ACHIEVEMENTS AND BADGES Achievements are milestones a user can complete. They give the user a future goal within the app and therefore increases the user retention. Example achievements: â€œFirst to review a park in Berlinâ€, â€œReviewed 20 places in 1 weekâ€, â€œCurated 1000+ reviewsâ€, â€œNo. 1 reviewer in Januaryâ€, etc. Users will collect digital badges for doing something special. Digital badges are going to be displayed publicly on user accounts. Achievements and badge collection are proven gamification mechanics. The point of them is to boost users engagement, give users a purpose and just make the app more fun to use. Apart from the achievements users may get additional badges like â€œEarly supporterâ€ for all of you reading our whitepaper and being amongst the first supporters-.  LEVELS Account level represents the state and trust of this account and is visible publicly. Users level up their accounts by contributing to the platform in various ways (posting reviews, curating, reporting, creating guidesâ€¦). High level accounts get more respect from the community and getting to a high level unlocks additional features only available to the most trusted reviewers. Levels is another proven gamification technique that incentivizes the user to contribute more.  ONBOARDING Nobody likes learning, thatâ€™s why the onboarding phase (tutorial phase) is one of the key points in user experience where users must not be intimidated by the app. Game development industry has found various ways of implementing tutorials without players even feeling like they are in a tutorial, but rather that theyâ€™re just playing the game as it is. Weâ€™ll make the initial onboarding phase clear and easy, without much textual instructions.

Author: Futourist
Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: Hi!  That's a good question. Curator will typically just upvote and downvote reviews. He will not be able to do that on his own post.  Fairness of evaluation is guaranteed with the following facts: - Trusted users will have more voting power (high level accounts) - The upvote power shall be adapted to the behaviour of each user (if you watch 10 videos and do 10 upvotes, your voting power should not be as high, as someone who gave 1 upvote to the best of 100 watched videos) - We'll have phone verification at account creation to prevent as much bots being created as possible - Fraudulent accounts (upvoting spammers, bots that get through,..) will be traced by our AI finding behavioral patterns for such accounts, before the reward is given (there is a time period after the review is created, when the community has their say about the review). We're very glad to have an experienced AI expert in our team, they are very rare to find these days.

Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: There will be several types of reviews. Users on platform acting as curators will determine what type of review gets most of the reward. Reward for review within same context/type will be distributed by Pareto distribution.  Brief explanation of Pareto distribution (quoted from Wikipedia): Pareto originally used this distribution to describe the allocation of wealth among individuals since it seemed to show rather well the way that a larger portion of the wealth of any society is owned by a smaller percentage of the people in that society. He also used it to describe distribution of income.[8] This idea is sometimes expressed more simply as the Pareto principle or the "80-20 rule" which says that 20% of the population controls 80% of the wealth.[9]

Title: [ANN] Futourist - travel review platform where you get paid for your content
Body: WHAT IS FUTOURIST? https://futourist.io/ https://futourist.io/ico https://futourist.io/whitepaper Futourist is the first travel review platform that rewards you for your reviews with crypto tokens. On Futourist you will be able to claim the newly introduced Futourist Tokens (FTR) in return for your reviews of travel services and places, depending on the quality of that review (community upvotes).  â–„â–„â–„ VISION  Did you know that the online content marketing industry is expected to generate more than $300 billion (!) in revenue by the year 2019 (source)? But when it comes to sharing that revenue, content creators tend not the be a part of the story at all! Futourist's team is here to change that! Our vision is to bring fairness to online content creation by creating an economy where creators are financially rewarded for their content with Futourist Tokens (FTR).  Why travel reviews? Because they're one of the most trustworthy and helpful information on the internet. They shape how we see things on a daily basis and most importantly - they're directly related to business revenue. The number of written reviews has reached 500 million on TripAdvisor alone. According to recent statistics, 90% of consumers read online reviews, and 88% of them trust them (source). Furthermore, 89% of consumers say they read more than 2 reviews (source).  Travel review industry is big and hasn't been disturbed in a long time. Platforms are failing to embrace new technologies and the whole field is stagnating. On top of rewarding reviewers with tokens, we'll be focusing on video reviews and catering influencers - things no other review platform has successfully exploited.  â–„â–„â–„ HOW DOES IT WORK?  Futourist is a travel review platform, focusing on video reviews and catering the influencers. On Futourist, you will be able to review anything travel related, anywhere, at any time. From restaurants to accomodation, parks, things to do, transport etc.  Futourist for a consumer - Search, watch, visit  Participants in the ecosystem Reviewer - is a registered user that provides content (reviews) Curator - a registered user that reads the content and uses upvotes to reward his/her preferred reviews or other content (can be a Reviewer as well) Consumer - users who do not contribute to the platform but consume information from it Business - a company who uses Futourist in order to spread awareness / make direct sales / get other benefits like audience analytics etc.  Contests - core feature  The Futourist platform will reward reviewers for participation in time-limited reviewing contests. Having limited time period contests allows us to distribute tokens in a straight-forward way - after the end of the contest, to all content creators which participated, with a predefined token distribution curve. After the contest ends, all applicable reviews will be sorted by their upvotes and downvotes. Then we're going to use the Pareto principle on these reviews in order to distribute rewards as fairly as possible.

Body: |  FUTOURIST ICO  |  WEBPAGE  |  WHITEPAPER  |  TELEGRAM  |  MEDIUM  |  FACEBOOK  |  INSTAGRAM  |  TWITTER  |   â–„â–„â–„ KYC PROCESS  1. Go to Futourist KYC website https://kyc.futourist.io 2. Wait for the confirmation email regarding your application  â–„â–„â–„ WHAT IS FUTOURIST?  Futourist is the first travel review platform that rewards you for your reviews with crypto tokens. On Futourist you will be able to claim the newly introduced Futourist Tokens (FTR) in return for your reviews of travel services and places, depending on the quality of that review (community upvotes).  â–„â–„â–„ VISION  Did you know that the online content marketing industry is expected to generate more than $300 billion (!) in revenue by the year 2019 (source)? But when it comes to sharing that revenue, content creators tend not the be a part of the story at all! Futourist's team is here to change that! Our vision is to bring fairness to online content creation by creating an economy where creators are financially rewarded for their content with Futourist Tokens (FTR).  Why travel reviews? Because they're one of the most trustworthy and helpful information on the internet. They shape how we see things on a daily basis and most importantly - they're directly related to business revenue. The number of written reviews has reached 500 million on TripAdvisor alone. According to recent statistics, 90% of consumers read online reviews, and 88% of them trust them (source). Furthermore, 89% of consumers say they read more than 2 reviews (source).  Travel review industry is big and hasn't been disturbed in a long time. Platforms are failing to embrace new technologies and the whole field is stagnating. On top of rewarding reviewers with tokens, we'll be focusing on video reviews and catering influencers - things no other review platform has successfully exploited.  â–„â–„â–„ HOW DOES IT WORK?  Futourist is a travel review platform, focusing on video reviews and catering the influencers. On Futourist, you will be able to review anything travel related, anywhere, at any time. From restaurants to accomodation, parks, things to do, transport etc. Futourist for a consumer - Search, watch, visit  Participants in the ecosystem Reviewer - is a registered user that provides content (reviews) Curator - a registered user that reads the content and uses upvotes to reward his/her preferred reviews or other content (can be a Reviewer as well) Consumer - users who do not contribute to the platform but consume information from it Business - a company who uses Futourist in order to spread awareness / make direct sales / get other benefits like audience analytics etc.  Contests - core feature  The Futourist platform will reward reviewers for participation in time-limited reviewing contests. Having limited time period contests allows us to distribute tokens in a straight-forward way - after the end of the contest, to all content creators which participated, with a predefined token distribution curve. After the contest ends, all applicable reviews will be sorted by their upvotes and downvotes. Then we're going to use the Pareto principle on these reviews in order to distribute rewards as fairly as possible. Futourist for a reviewer - shoot, review, get rewarded  Futourist will include many other features and token utilities which are described in our whitepaper.  Token utilities and circulation            For the explanation of the above token utilities please refer to our whitepaper.  â–„â–„â–„ AN EXISTING PRODUCT Futourist has partnered up with a popular service list site called OpenHours. OpenHours is a platform with over 1 million monthly active users and is present in 21 western countries. It has a huge database of services available in those countries. It has all - service database including existing reviews, established technology infrastructure (several localized web and mobile apps) and the users we can convert. We will use OpenHours for the foundation on top of which we'll build Futourist.  OpenHours mobile application (available on your app store)  â–„â–„â–„ MARKET  Revenue of content marketing services was worth more than $190 billion in the year 2016 and is expected to be worth more than $313 billion by the year 2019 (source). From early researches it is estimated that almost $31 billion a year of UK consumer spending is potentially influenced by online reviews (source). The market size of online review industry was in the range of $3-7 billion in 2015 in North America alone (source).  The number of written reviews has reached 500 million on TripAdvisor alone. According to recent statistics, 90% of consumers read online reviews and 88% of them trust them (source). Furthermore, 89% of consumers say they read more than 2 reviews before making a decision (source).  Competition At this moment, we do not have a direct competitor that would reward the contributors using blockchain. Our real competition exists in the old economy, with companies like TripAdvisor, Foursquare and Yelp. But these and other platforms do not incentivize their users with meaningful rewards, they did not embrace video content and they do not offer any space to travel influencers.  Main differences between us and the competition: Quality content creation incentive through token rewards Focusing on video reviews Catering the influencers (long-tail included)  â–„â–„â–„ ROADMAP      â–„â–„â–„ TEAM  The team behind Futourist is an experienced entrepreneurial team, coming from various industries - from web and app development to tourism, games and marketing.
